Respiratory-related diseases continue to
increase in Northern China. In
recent days, with the majority of infections being children,
Chinese authorities are urgently
taking measures to control
the situation in the context of the country's current crisis.  The
start of winter is considered
favorable for respiratory diseases to
develop, according to cctv television stations.
Waiting rooms at hospitals yesterday,
November 26, Winter is crowded with people and many
young children, including newborns, must breathe oxygen.
Doctors have encouraged parents to
take their children for medical treatment as quickly as
possible if their children show any symptoms
especially for children under 3 months old
according to a spokesperson for the national health commission
China's
recent respiratory infections are mainly
caused by influenza viruses and a number of
other malignancy viruses. The World Health Organization
last week confirmed there were no
new or unusual pathogens.
found during this outbreak,
China's national health commission recommends
increasing the number of clinics and treatment areas
to ensure medicine supply and to
strengthen disease prevention in
crowded places such as schools.  In children's facilities
and nursing homes, this agency also
emphasized that vaccination is the
most effective disease prevention measure, especially for
the elderly and those with medical conditions.
